attributes.action: call off the HMRC's court action against Leeds United.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: This court case is over the CVA and the offer of 1p (revised to 8p) in the £1. However this court action is forcing the club into liquidation which would cause football to lose one of its biggest names, and meaning a zero return for creditors. Leeds United is the sole professional football club in Leeds with a much wider catchment area throughout Yorkshire. There is therefore a huge potential for Leeds United to overcome its current difficulties and return to the Championship and then the Premiership.  This would give HMRC a better long term return than any proposed court action.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
